parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and echo; to hold upon, i.e. to retain; to detain; to pay attention to.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A boasting; a ground of boasting (glorying, exultation). From kauchaomai; a boast in a good or a bad sense.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Apparently a primary verb; which uses dremo drem'-o as alternate in certain tenses; to run or walk hastily.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
